name: indivisibly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not able to be separated from something else or into different parts: indivisibly linked Our country has a global foreign policy but our security is indivisibly linked with that of Europe. Their alliance seems indivisibly strong. See
indivisible
More examplesFewer examplesUrbanization and development are indivisibly linked one to another. Throughout this TV series, music is indivisibly part of the whole.This old tree represented a connection to country, linking indivisibly with the natural world.
